actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

official_title: A bill to amend the Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to provide that a rescission or reservation of funds proposed by the President may be disapproved by either House of Congress without waiting for the expiration of the 45-day period prescribed for congressional action under present law.

summary.text: Amends the Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to provide that a rescission or reservation of funds proposed by the President may be disapproved by either House of Congress without waiting for the expiration of the 45-day period prescribed for congressional action under present law.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to provide that a rescission or reservation of funds proposed by the President may be disapproved by either House of Congress without waiting for the expiration of the 45-day period prescribed for congressional action under present law.
